author: E. Marcel Pourtout mpourtout@neighbornewspapers.com (noreply@neighbornewspapers.com)
title: Football in season’s second half
text: slideshow With the passing of the halfway point for the prep football regular season, programs have entered the second half of their campaigns ready to move up their region standings.Riverwood has won three of their first four contests, including a 40-3 home victory over North Atlanta in its Region 7 opener on Sept. 18. Marvin Kinsey, Jr. had another stellar performance for the Knights, rushing for a game-high 157 yards a touchdown in the victory. Brennan Suttle and Porter Sanford each had a touchdown pass for Riverwood while its defense forced four North Atlanta turnovers. Riverwood’s Myles Simmons had a game-high 11 tackles.The Knights return to action this Friday in Marietta for another region contest, this time at Sprayberry which has also started the season 3-1. The Yellow Jackets won their last contest 33-7 over North Springs. Sprayberry holds a 4-3 series lead over Riverwood, including last season’s 31-24 double-overtime road win last season.North Atlanta, which has started the season with a 2-2 record, will look to rebound off of its Riverwood defeat by hosting Cambridge out of Milton this Friday. The Warriors rushed for 159 yards against the Knights led by KD Welsh’s 97 yards on the ground.Cambridge has won two of its first three games but was defeated by Rome 21-14 on Sept. 11. Last season, the Bears defeated the Warriors 45-3 in the lone meeting between the two teams.Staying within Region 7 , North Springs returns to the field off of a bye week against Kell in Marietta. The Spartans, who have dropped three of their first four contests to start this season, face the Longhorns who have started 3-1 and made the state playoffs each of the past seven years. Kell has won all three previous meetings against North Springs including last year’s 55-14 victory.Holy Innocents’ visits B.E.S.T. Academy in Atlanta this Friday for a Region 6AA matchup at Lakewood Stadium. The Golden Bears look to gain a region win after dropping its contest at Pace Academy 26-0 on Sept. 18. B.E.S.T. Academy has lost three of its first four games, dropping its last contest to Lovett 38-6. The Eagles defeated the Golden Bears 20-19 in last year’s game.Holy Spirit Prep has won two of its last three contests after starting its 2015 campaign 0-2. The Cougars defeated Bethlehem Christian Academy 30-6 on Sept. 18 behind Bryan Mocarski’s two touchdown passes to Nicholas Maddox. Davey O’Haren ran for 127 yards and two touchdowns in the victory. Ryan Dunham had three interceptions for Holy Spirit’s defense.The Cougars return to the field this Friday hosting Trinity Christian out of Sharpsburg in a Georgia Independent School Association Region 1AAA contest. Trinity Christian has started its season 3-2 and won last season’s game against Holy Spirit 28-7.Several programs are off this Friday coming off of victories Sept. 18 and 19. Mount Vernon Presbyterian won its last contest at Cross Keys 45-7, giving the Mustangs two wins on the season which already matches last year’s total. Jacob Cavendar had three touchdown passes in the victory while Ahmir Lee rushed for two scores on a game-high 71 yards on the ground.Lovett earned its first win of the season with a 38-6 over B.E.S.T. Academy behind a school-record 263 yards rushing from Jay Harris on 23 carries. He also had two touchdowns in the contest. Sam Perry and Chase Carter each had an interception while Ian Herbert posted a sack for the Lions “It was good to get our first win of the season,” Lovett coach Mike Muschamp said. “The kids have worked real hard and we faced a tough non-region schedule. We have to continue to win in our region for a playoff spot.”Pace Academy pushed its undefeated streak to five games to start this season with a 26-0 shutout of Holy Innocents’. It’s the first time in Knights’ history that they’ve reached this accomplishment. Deon Jackson rushed for 162 yards and a touchdown in the victory.Westminster defeated Towers 32-8 in Decatur on Sept. 19, improving its record to 2-2 on the season.
